Sentencas: The long-term properties of Ni/yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells were evaluated experimentally.
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A total of 13 anodes of three types based on two commercial NiO powders were examined.
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The durability was evaluated at temperatures of 850 (degrees)C, 1000 (degrees)C and 1050 (degrees)C over 1300 to 2000 h at an anodic d.c. load of 300 mA cm(-2) in hydrogen with 1 to 3% water.
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The anode-related polarization resistance, R(P), was measured by impedance spectroscopy and found to be in the range of 0.05 to 0.7 Omega cm(2).
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: After an initial stabilization period of up to 300 h, R(P) varied linearly with time within the experimental uncertainty.
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells
Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: At 1000 (degrees)C a degradation rate of 10 m Omega cm(2) per 1000 h was found.
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The degradation rate was possibly higher at 850 (degrees)C. A single anode was exposed to nine thermal cycles from 1000 to below 100 (degrees)C at 100 (degrees)C h(-1).
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: An increase in R(P) of about 30 m Omega cm(2) was observed over the first two cycles.
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: For the following thermal cycles R(P) was stable within the experimental uncertainty.
Titulo: Durability and thermal cycling of Ni/YSZ cermet anodes for solid oxide fuel cells
